ground_truth: Banky leans back into the couch, wearing a thoughtful face, as the Execs and Sloss laugh, prompting Holden and Banky to politely join in, though Banky shoots Holden a 'these guys are idiots' look, and Holden smiles. Later, Alyssa and Holden walk through the park, eating hot dogs, and upon reaching a swing set, they sit down on the swings. Alyssa holds up her hand, and after swallowing what she's chewing, she releases her tongue, which is just huge, leaving Holden transfixed. Alyssa wraps it back up with a smile and stands, then exits while Holden remains in the swing. Alyssa returns as Banky tries to balance way-too-much luggage, while Holden checks his beeper and exits. Banky starts packing his magazines up, and a little kid enters, staring at him before disappearing, leaving Banky standing open-mouthed. They head toward the skee-ball runs, where Holden rolls the ball, landing it in a twenty-point circle. Alyssa picks up a ball, squints to aim, and throws it overhand, causing it to pop off one of the circles and shoot back, making them duck. Holden reacts as Alyssa laughs, and he ducks again as the ball comes sailing back at his head, then gets up and throws the ball in surprise, causing it to ricochet off the ceiling and smash through the glass of an old pinball machine, while Alyssa laughs. Later, Banky sits there, shocked, puts the controller down, and crosses to the drawing table, where Holden starts drawing as Banky stares at him, then starts drawing something himself. Banky draws a four-way stop, finishes drawing, and illustrates according to his voice-over. Holden shakes his head and storms away, with Banky following. Holden looks at Banky for a long moment as Banky stares back, then suddenly softens and drops his head, looks into Holden's eyes, and walks away, while Holden watches him go and exits. Alyssa picks through her food as she and Holden sit at a booth, then she grabs her bag, slides out of the booth, and heads to the cashier's desk with Holden following, offering a puzzled shrug. Alyssa gestures with a 'just wait' finger when the cashier turns to her, as Holden stares at her, then ahead, swerving the wheel to the right to pull the car to the side of the road, throws it into park, noting the rain is a bit heavier now. Holden stares at Alyssa, and she stares back before getting out of the car. With the rain now pouring, Alyssa starts hitching up the road, and Holden reaches her, with both being drenched. She shakes her head ruefully and walks away, leaving Holden standing there at a loss before he turns and heads back to his car.

test_cases.name: Synonym Substitution
test_cases.description: Banky reclines back into the sofa, wearing a pensive expression, as the Executives and Sloss chuckle, prompting Holden and Banky to courteously join in, though Banky sends Holden a 'these folks are morons' look, and Holden grins. Later, Alyssa and Holden stroll through the park, consuming hot dogs, and upon arriving at a swing set, they sit down on the swings. Alyssa raises up her hand, and after swallowing what she's munching, she unfurls her tongue, which is just enormous, leaving Holden mesmerized. Alyssa retracts it back up with a grin and stands, then departs while Holden remains in the swing. Alyssa returns as Banky attempts to balance excessive baggage, while Holden checks his pager and departs. Banky begins gathering his periodicals up, and a small child enters, gazing at him before vanishing, leaving Banky standing agape. They head toward the skee-ball lanes, where Holden rolls the sphere, landing it in a twenty-point ring. Alyssa picks up a sphere, squints to aim, and hurls it overhand, causing it to rebound off one of the rings and shoot back, making them crouch. Holden reacts as Alyssa chuckles, and he ducks again as the sphere comes flying back at his head, then gets up and throws the sphere in astonishment, causing it to ricochet off the ceiling and smash through the glass of an old pinball apparatus, while Alyssa chuckles. Later, Banky sits there, astonished, puts the controller down, and crosses to the drafting table, where Holden starts sketching as Banky gazes at him, then starts sketching something himself. Banky sketches a four-way intersection, completes sketching, and illustrates according to his narration. Holden shakes his head and storms away, with Banky pursuing. Holden looks at Banky for a long moment as Banky gazes back, then suddenly softens and drops his head, looks into Holden's eyes, and walks away, while Holden watches him leave and departs. Alyssa picks through her meal as she and Holden sit at a booth, then she grabs her bag, slides out of the booth, and heads to the cashier's counter with Holden following, offering a perplexed shrug. Alyssa gestures with a 'just wait' finger when the cashier turns to her, as Holden gazes at her, then ahead, swerving the wheel to the right to pull the automobile to the side of the road, throws it into park, noting the rain is a bit more intense now. Holden gazes at Alyssa, and she gazes back before getting out of the automobile. With the rain now pouring, Alyssa starts hitching up the street, and Holden reaches her, with both being drenched. She shakes her head ruefully and walks away, leaving Holden standing there at a loss before he turns and heads back to his automobile.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: Banky leans back on the couch with a thoughtful expression as Execs and Sloss laugh. Holden and Banky join in, but Banky gives Holden a 'these guys are idiots' look. Later, Alyssa and Holden walk through the park eating hot dogs, then sit on swings. Alyssa reveals her large tongue, leaving Holden transfixed. She smiles, stands, and leaves Holden on the swing. Alyssa returns as Banky struggles with excessive luggage, while Holden checks his beeper and leaves. Banky packs his magazines as a kid stares and then disappears, leaving Banky stunned. They head to the skee-ball lanes, where Holden scores twenty points. Alyssa aims and throws overhand, causing the ball to ricochet, making them duck. Alyssa laughs as Holden is surprised by the ball smashing a pinball machine. Later, Banky puts down the controller and joins Holden at the drawing table, each drawing their ideas. Banky sketches a four-way stop and illustrates it. Holden shakes his head and leaves, with Banky following. Holden and Banky share a long look before Banky softens, drops his head, and walks away. Alyssa and Holden sit in a booth; she grabs her bag and heads to the cashier as Holden follows. With a finger gesture, Alyssa asks Holden to wait. The rain intensifies as Holden pulls the car over, he and Alyssa staring at each other. She exits and starts hitching in the rain. Holden reaches her, both drenched. Alyssa shakes her head and walks away, leaving Holden to return to his car.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: Banky leans back on the couch, looking thoughtful as the Execs and Sloss laugh, prompting Holden and Banky to join in. Banky gives Holden a 'these guys are idiots' look, and Holden smiles. Later, Alyssa and Holden walk in the park, eat hot dogs, and sit on swings. Alyssa shows her large tongue, leaving Holden transfixed. She stands, exits, and then returns as Banky struggles with too much luggage, while Holden checks his beeper and leaves. Banky packs his magazines when a kid stares briefly, leaving him open-mouthed. At the skee-ball runs, Holden scores points, Alyssa's overhand throw makes the ball bounce back, causing them to duck. Alyssa laughs as Holden's throw smashes a pinball machine. Later, Banky and Holden draw at the table. Banky illustrates a four-way stop, and after finishing, Holden storms off, with Banky following. They exchange glances before Banky softens and walks away, while Holden watches. Alyssa and Holden sit in a booth; she leaves to pay, and Holden follows, puzzled. Alyssa gestures for him to wait as the cashier turns to her. Holden swerves the car to the side of the road in heavier rain. Alyssa gets out, walks away, and Holden stands at a loss before returning to his car.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description:
Banky reclines comfortably into the plush couch, his expression thoughtful and contemplative, as the Executives and Sloss burst into laughter, prompting both Holden and Banky to join in politely. During this moment of shared humor, Banky subtly casts a sideways glance at Holden, conveying a silent 'these guys are idiots' sentiment. Holden responds with an amused smile. Later on, Alyssa and Holden find themselves taking a leisurely stroll through the picturesque park, enjoying hot dogs along the way. As they meander through the greenery, they approach a swing set and decide to sit down. Alyssa, without much ado, holds up her hand, and after swallowing the food she is savoring, she dramatically reveals her tongue, which is notably large, leaving Holden utterly captivated and wide-eyed. Alyssa, with a charming smile, tucks her tongue back in place, stands with an air of satisfaction, and leaves the swings, while Holden remains seated, deep in thought.

Alyssa returns just as Banky is comically attempting to manage an overwhelming amount of luggage, his balance precarious. Meanwhile, Holden, upon noticing an alert on his beeper, makes his exit. Banky starts to gather his magazines, methodically packing them away. In the midst of this, a curious little kid enters the scene, casting an intrigued glance at Banky before suddenly vanishing, leaving Banky standing there, mouth agape in bewilderment. They eventually make their way to the lively skee-ball area, where Holden rolls the ball with precision, managing to land it in a twenty-point scoring circle. Alyssa, not one to be outdone, picks up a ball and, with a playful squint, aims carefully before tossing it overhand. Her throw results in the ball bouncing off one of the circles and shooting back toward them unexpectedly, causing them to duck in surprise. Holden reacts with quick reflexes as Alyssa bursts into laughter. He ducks once more as the ball makes another unpredictable return, heading straight for his head. Recovering from the surprise, Holden stands and throws a ball in surprise, which bounces unpredictably, ricochets off the ceiling, and shatters the glass of an aged pinball machine, all the while Alyssa's laughter rings through the air.

Later, Banky sits in stunned silence, placing the controller down with disbelief. He crosses the room to join Holden at the drawing table, where Holden has begun sketching. Banky watches intently before starting to draw something of his own. He meticulously sketches out a four-way stop and continues to illustrate, narrating quietly to himself as he goes. Holden, visibly frustrated, shakes his head in disbelief, abruptly storms away, with Banky trailing after him. Holden pauses, giving Banky a long, searching look. Banky meets his gaze steadily before suddenly softening, dropping his head slightly, and looking deeply into Holden's eyes. He turns and walks away, with Holden watching him go before finally exiting himself.

Alyssa is in the midst of picking through her meal as she and Holden sit together in a booth. As she finishes, she gathers her bag, gracefully slides out of the booth, and heads toward the cashier's desk, with Holden trailing her, offering a bewildered shrug. Alyssa, sensing his gaze, gestures with a 'just wait' finger when the cashier acknowledges her, while Holden looks on, then turns his attention forward, deftly steering the car to the right to pull over to the side of the road. Having parked the car, they note that the rain has intensified. Holden stares intently at Alyssa, who returns his gaze before exiting the vehicle. With the rain now pouring heavily, Alyssa begins making her way up the road, hitching amid the downpour. Holden quickly follows, both of them getting drenched by the relentless rain. Alyssa shakes her head ruefully, silently indicating her resolve, and then walks away, leaving Holden standing there, utterly at a loss. He eventually turns, feeling the weight of the moment, and heads back to his car, leaving the scene behind.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description:
Banky reclines comfortably into the plush couch, his expression a mix of thoughtful contemplation and introspection, as the Executives and Sloss erupt into a hearty bout of laughter. This jovial atmosphere prompts both Holden and Banky to join in, albeit politely. During this moment of shared humor and camaraderie, Banky subtly casts a sideways glance at Holden, his eyes conveying an unspoken sentiment that these guys are complete idiots. Holden acknowledges this with an amused smile playing on his lips. Later on, Alyssa and Holden find themselves taking a leisurely and relaxed stroll through the picturesque park, taking the time to savor delicious hot dogs along the way. As they meander through the lush greenery, they come upon a swingset and decide to sit down for a while. Alyssa, with a casual demeanor, holds up her hand, and after swallowing the food she is savoring, she dramatically reveals her tongue, which is notably large and unexpected, leaving Holden utterly captivated and wide-eyed with surprise. Alyssa, with a charming and playful smile, tucks her tongue back in place, stands with an air of satisfaction, and gracefully leaves the swings, while Holden remains seated, lost in his deep thoughts.

Alyssa returns to the scene just as Banky is comically struggling to manage an overwhelming amount of luggage, his balance precarious and teetering on the edge. Meanwhile, Holden, upon noticing an alert on his beeper, makes his swift exit. Banky begins to gather his magazines, methodically packing them away with care. In the midst of this bustling scene, a curious little kid enters, casting an intrigued glance at Banky before suddenly vanishing, leaving Banky standing there, mouth agape in sheer bewilderment. They eventually make their way to the lively skee-ball area, where Holden expertly rolls the ball with precision, managing to land it in a twenty-point scoring circle. Alyssa, not one to be outdone by Holden's skill, picks up a ball and, with a playful squint, aims carefully before tossing it overhand. Her throw results in the ball bouncing off one of the circles and shooting back toward them unexpectedly, causing them both to duck in surprise. Holden reacts with quick reflexes, as Alyssa bursts into laughter. He ducks once more as the ball makes another unpredictable return, heading straight for his head. Recovering from the sudden surprise, Holden stands and throws a ball in return, which bounces unpredictably, ricochets off the ceiling, and shatters the glass of an aged pinball machine, all the while Alyssa's laughter rings through the air, echoing with amusement.

Later, Banky sits in stunned silence, placing the controller down with disbelief etched on his face. He crosses the room to join Holden at the drawing table, where Holden has begun to sketch diligently. Banky watches intently before starting to draw something of his own, meticulously sketching out a four-way stop and continuing to illustrate, narrating quietly to himself as he goes. Holden, visibly frustrated and at the end of his patience, shakes his head in disbelief, abruptly storming away, with Banky trailing after him. Holden pauses, giving Banky a long, searching look filled with complexity. Banky meets his gaze steadily, before suddenly softening, dropping his head slightly, and looking deeply into Holden's eyes. He turns and walks away, with Holden watching him go before finally exiting himself from the scene.

Alyssa is in the midst of picking through her meal as she and Holden sit together in a cozy booth. As she finishes, she gathers her bag, gracefully sliding out of the booth, and heads toward the cashier's desk, with Holden trailing behind her, offering a bewildered shrug. Alyssa, sensing his curious gaze, gestures with a reassuring 'just wait' finger when the cashier acknowledges her, while Holden looks on, then turns his attention forward, deftly steering the car to the right to pull over to the side of the road. Having parked the car, they note that the rain has intensified considerably. Holden stares intently at Alyssa, who returns his gaze before exiting the vehicle. With the rain now pouring heavily, Alyssa begins making her way up the road, hitching amid the relentless downpour. Holden quickly follows, both of them getting thoroughly drenched by the driving rain. Alyssa shakes her head ruefully, silently indicating her resolute determination, and then walks away, leaving Holden standing there, utterly at a loss and bewildered. He eventually turns, feeling the weight of the moment upon him, and heads back to his car, leaving the drenched scene and moment behind.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: Banky slowly leans back into the couch, adopting a contemplative expression as the Execs and Sloss burst into laughter. In response, both Holden and Banky join in the laughter out of politeness, though Banky discreetly shoots Holden a look that silently communicates his opinion that these guys are fools, and Holden acknowledges it with a smile. Later, Alyssa and Holden meander through the park, each savoring a hot dog as they stroll. Upon reaching a swing set, they settle down on the swings, gently rocking back and forth. Alyssa raises her hand, signaling Holden to pause, and after she swallows the food in her mouth, she dramatically extends her tongue, which reveals itself to be unusually large, leaving Holden utterly mesmerized. With a playful smile, Alyssa retracts her tongue, stands up from the swing, and walks away, leaving Holden sitting on the swing, bewildered. Alyssa soon returns as Banky struggles to manage an awkwardly large amount of luggage, attempting to find balance, while Holden checks his beeper and takes his leave. Banky begins to gather and organize his scattered magazines, and as he does so, a young child enters the scene, stopping to stare curiously at Banky before vanishing from sight, leaving Banky standing there in open-mouthed astonishment. They proceed to the skee-ball lanes, where Holden takes his turn, carefully rolling the ball and successfully landing it within a twenty-point circle. Alyssa then picks up a ball, squints with determination as she aims, and throws it with an overhand motion, inadvertently causing it to ricochet off one of the circles and rebound toward them, prompting both to duck. Holden instinctively ducks again as the ball, defying expectations, sails back toward his head. He then rises, and in a moment of surprise, he throws the ball with an unexpected trajectory, causing it to careen off the ceiling and shatter the glass of an old pinball machine, eliciting laughter from Alyssa. Later, Banky sits there in disbelief, slowly placing the controller down. He moves over to the drawing table, observing Holden as he begins sketching. Banky watches intently before starting to draw something of his own. Banky illustrates a four-way stop and concludes his drawing, narrating over his illustration. Meanwhile, Holden shakes his head in frustration and abruptly storms away, prompting Banky to follow. Holden pauses to fixate on Banky for an extended moment, meeting Banky's gaze until Banky, unexpectedly softening, lowers his head, meets Holden's eyes, and then turns to walk away, leaving Holden to watch him depart before he exits. As Alyssa sifts through her meal with Holden seated beside her in a booth, she reaches for her bag, slides out from the booth, and makes her way toward the cashier's desk. Holden trails after her, offering a puzzled shrug in response to the sudden movement. Alyssa holds up a finger in a 'just wait' gesture when the cashier responds to her, leaving Holden to observe her in confusion. He then redirects his focus ahead, swerving the wheel to the right and maneuvering the car to the side of the road, engaging the parking gear, and noting that the rain has intensified. Holden fixates on Alyssa, and she returns his gaze before she exits the car. With the rain now torrential, Alyssa begins to walk up the road in search of a ride, and Holden catches up with her, both becoming soaked through. She shakes her head with a sense of resignation and continues walking away, leaving Holden standing there, puzzled and at a loss, before he eventually turns back and makes his way to his car.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description: Banky reclines thoughtfully on the couch while the Execs and Sloss laugh, causing Holden and Banky to join in, though Banky discreetly shares a skeptical glance with Holden. Later, Holden and Alyssa walk through the park eating hot dogs and sit on swings. Alyssa reveals her impressively large tongue, captivating Holden before she leaves him at the swing set. Alyssa returns as Banky struggles with excessive luggage, prompting Holden to check his beeper and depart. Banky repacks his magazines after a brief encounter with a curious child. At the skee-ball runs, Holden scores while Alyssa’s wild throw sends them ducking, and as the ball ricochets perilously, Holden's surprised throw shatters a pinball machine, much to Alyssa’s amusement. Afterwards, a stunned Banky abandons a video game and joins Holden at the drawing table, both starting to sketch. Their creative session turns tense with Holden storming off, while Banky follows, resulting in a silent exchange and Banky eventually walking away as Holden watches him leave. Alyssa and Holden sit in a booth, with Alyssa departing to the cashier's desk, prompting Holden to follow, confused. Alyssa signals for him to wait while dealing with the cashier, leading to a drive in the rain. Holden pulls the car over, and they silently confront each other before Alyssa exits into the downpour. Holden catches up to her, both getting drenched, but she ultimately walks away, leaving Holden stranded in the rain before he returns to his car.

Alyssa wraps it back up with a smile and stands then exits while Holden remains in the swing. Alyssa returns as Banky tries to balance waytoomuch luggage while Holden checks his beeper and exits. Banky starts packing his magazines up and a little kid enters staring at him before disappearing leaving Banky standing openmouthed. They head toward the skeeball runs where Holden rolls the ball landing it in a twentypoint circle. Alyssa picks up a ball squints to aim and throws it overhand causing it to pop off one of the circles and shoot back making them duck. Holden reacts as Alyssa laughs and he ducks again as the ball comes sailing back at his head then gets up and throws the ball in surprise causing it to ricochet off the ceiling and smash through the glass of an old pinball machine while Alyssa laughs. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. Later Banky sits there shocked puts the controller down and crosses to the drawing table where Holden starts drawing as Banky stares at him then starts drawing something himself. Banky draws a fourway stop finishes drawing and illustrates according to his voiceover. Holden shakes his head and storms away with Banky following. Holden looks at Banky for a long moment as Banky stares back then suddenly softens and drops his head looks into Holden's eyes and walks away while Holden watches him go and exits. Alyssa picks through her food as she and Holden sit at a booth then she grabs her bag slides out of the booth and heads to the cashier's desk with Holden following offering a puzzled shrug. Alyssa gestures with a 'just wait' finger when the cashier turns to her as Holden stares at her then ahead swerving the wheel to the right to pull the car to the side of the road throws it into park noting the rain is a bit heavier now. Holden stares at Alyssa and she stares back before getting out of the car. With the rain now pouring Alyssa starts hitching up the road and Holden reaches her with both being drenched. She shakes her head ruefully and walks away leaving Holden standing there at a loss before he turns and heads back to his car.

test_cases.name: Subject Corruption
test_cases.description: The potted plant leans back into the couch, wearing a thoughtful face, as the dolphins and the lamp post laugh, prompting the mailbox and the potted plant to politely join in, though the potted plant shoots the mailbox a 'these guys are idiots' look, and the mailbox smiles. Later, the goldfish and the mailbox walk through the park, eating hot dogs, and upon reaching a swing set, they sit down on the swings. The goldfish holds up its hand, and after swallowing what it's chewing, it releases its tongue, which is just huge, leaving the mailbox transfixed. The goldfish wraps it back up with a smile and stands, then exits while the mailbox remains in the swing. The goldfish returns as the potted plant tries to balance way-too-much luggage, while the mailbox checks its beeper and exits. The potted plant starts packing its magazines up, and a little kid enters, staring at it before disappearing, leaving the potted plant standing open-mouthed. They head toward the skee-ball runs, where the mailbox rolls the ball, landing it in a twenty-point circle. The goldfish picks up a ball, squints to aim, and throws it overhand, causing it to pop off one of the circles and shoot back, making them duck. The mailbox reacts as the goldfish laughs, and it ducks again as the ball comes sailing back at its head, then gets up and throws the ball in surprise, causing it to ricochet off the ceiling and smash through the glass of an old pinball machine, while the goldfish laughs. Later, the potted plant sits there, shocked, puts the controller down, and crosses to the drawing table, where the mailbox starts drawing as the potted plant stares at it, then starts drawing something itself. The potted plant draws a four-way stop, finishes drawing, and illustrates according to its voice-over. The mailbox shakes its head and storms away, with the potted plant following. The mailbox looks at the potted plant for a long moment as the potted plant stares back, then suddenly softens and drops its head, looks into the mailbox's eyes, and walks away, while the mailbox watches it go and exits. The goldfish picks through its food as it and the mailbox sit at a booth, then it grabs its bag, slides out of the booth, and heads to the cashier's desk with the mailbox following, offering a puzzled shrug. The goldfish gestures with a 'just wait' finger when the cashier turns to it, as the mailbox stares at it, then ahead, swerving the wheel to the right to pull the car to the side of the road, throws it into park, noting the rain is a bit heavier now. The mailbox stares at the goldfish, and it stares back before getting out of the car. With the rain now pouring, the goldfish starts hitching up the road, and the mailbox reaches it, with both being drenched. It shakes its head ruefully and walks away, leaving the mailbox standing there at a loss before it turns and heads back to its car.

test_cases.name: Object Corruption
test_cases.description: Banky leans back into the hammock, wearing a thoughtful face, as the Execs and Sloss laugh, prompting Holden and Banky to politely join in, though Banky shoots Holden a 'these guys are idiots' look, and Holden smiles. Later, Alyssa and Holden walk through the orchard, eating sandwiches, and upon reaching a seesaw, they sit down on the seats. Alyssa holds up her hand, and after swallowing what she's chewing, she releases her scarf, which is just huge, leaving Holden transfixed. Alyssa wraps it back up with a smile and stands, then exits while Holden remains on the seesaw. Alyssa returns as Banky tries to balance way-too-many vases, while Holden checks his pager and exits. Banky starts packing his newspapers up, and a little duck enters, staring at him before disappearing, leaving Banky standing open-mouthed. They head toward the mini-golf course, where Holden rolls the ball, landing it in a twenty-point hole. Alyssa picks up a club, squints to aim, and swings it overhand, causing the ball to pop off one of the targets and shoot back, making them duck. Holden reacts as Alyssa laughs, and he ducks again as the ball comes sailing back at his head, then gets up and swings in surprise, causing it to ricochet off the ceiling and smash through the glass of an old fish tank, while Alyssa laughs. Later, Banky sits there, shocked, puts the joystick down, and crosses to the drafting table, where Holden starts sketching as Banky stares at him, then starts drawing something himself. Banky draws a carousel, finishes drawing, and illustrates according to his voice-over. Holden shakes his head and storms away, with Banky following. Holden looks at Banky for a long moment as Banky stares back, then suddenly softens and drops his head, looks into Holden's eyes, and walks away, while Holden watches him go and exits. Alyssa picks through her salad as she and Holden sit in a stall, then she grabs her backpack, slides out of the stall, and heads to the counter with Holden following, offering a puzzled shrug. Alyssa gestures with a 'just wait' finger when the barista turns to her, as Holden stares at her, then ahead, swerving the wheel to the right to pull the bicycle to the side of the road, throws it into a rack, noting the mist is a bit heavier now. Holden stares at Alyssa, and she stares back before getting out of the bicycle. With the mist now pouring, Alyssa starts hitching up the road, and Holden reaches her, with both being drenched. She shakes her head ruefully and walks away, leaving Holden standing there at a loss before he turns and heads back to his bicycle.

test_cases.name: Action Corruption
test_cases.description: Banky slouches into the couch, wearing a thoughtful face, as the Execs and Sloss sing, prompting Holden and Banky to quietly hum along, though Banky signals Holden a 'these guys are idiots' look, and Holden nods. Later, Alyssa and Holden jog through the park, juggling hot dogs, and upon reaching a swing set, they lie down on the swings. Alyssa raises her hand, and after sipping what she's drinking, she shows her tongue, which is just huge, leaving Holden bewildered. Alyssa retracts it with a grin and jumps, then disappears while Holden remains on the swing. Alyssa reappears as Banky struggles to juggle way-too-much luggage, while Holden examines his beeper and disappears. Banky begins sorting his magazines, and a little kid appears, glaring at him before running, leaving Banky standing wide-eyed. They march toward the skee-ball runs, where Holden tosses the ball, landing it in a twenty-point circle. Alyssa lifts a ball, squints to aim, and catapults it overhand, causing it to deflect off one of the circles and ricochet back, making them dive. Holden flinches as Alyssa giggles, and he dives again as the ball comes zooming back at his head, then jumps up and kicks the ball in surprise, causing it to rebound off the ceiling and crash through the glass of an old pinball machine, while Alyssa giggles. Later, Banky stands there, astounded, drops the controller, and skips to the drawing table, where Holden begins sketching as Banky watches him, then begins sketching something himself. Banky sketches a four-way stop, completes sketching, and illustrates according to his voice-over. Holden shakes his head and marches away, with Banky trailing. Holden observes Banky for a long moment as Banky gazes back, then suddenly relaxes and bows his head, looks into Holden's eyes, and drifts away, while Holden watches him leave and vanishes. Alyssa sifts through her food as she and Holden sit at a booth, then she seizes her bag, slides out of the booth, and approaches the cashier's desk with Holden trailing, offering a puzzled shrug. Alyssa signals with a 'just wait' finger when the cashier turns to her, as Holden gazes at her, then ahead, swerving the wheel to the right to glide the car to the side of the road, tips it into park, noting the rain is a bit heavier now. Holden gazes at Alyssa, and she gazes back before escaping the car. With the rain now pouring, Alyssa begins jogging up the road, and Holden reaches her, with both being soaked. She shakes her head ruefully and strides away, leaving Holden standing there at a loss before he pivots and jogs back to his car.

test_cases.name: Subject-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: The toaster leans back into the hammock, wearing a thoughtful face, as the balloons and the frisbee laugh, prompting the mailbox and the toaster to politely join in, though the toaster shoots the mailbox a 'these cats are astronauts' look, and the mailbox smiles. Later, the pineapple and the mailbox walk through the aquarium, eating tacos, and upon reaching a treadmill, they sit down on the mats. The pineapple holds up its spatula, and after swallowing what it's chewing, it releases its scarf, which is just huge, leaving the mailbox transfixed. The pineapple wraps it back up with a smile and stands, then exits while the mailbox remains in the mat. The pineapple returns as the toaster tries to balance way-too-much spaghetti, while the mailbox checks its compass and exits. The toaster starts packing its postcards up, and a little robot enters, staring at it before disappearing, leaving the toaster standing open-mouthed. They head toward the tennis courts, where the mailbox rolls the ball, landing it in a twenty-point hoop. The pineapple picks up a ball, squints to aim, and throws it overhand, causing it to pop off one of the hoops and shoot back, making them duck. The mailbox reacts as the pineapple laughs, and it ducks again as the ball comes sailing back at its head, then gets up and throws the ball in surprise, causing it to ricochet off the ceiling and smash through the glass of an old lamp, while the pineapple laughs. Later, the toaster sits there, shocked, puts the spatula down, and crosses to the puzzle table, where the mailbox starts drawing as the toaster stares at it, then starts drawing something itself. The toaster draws a four-way river, finishes drawing, and illustrates according to its voice-over. The mailbox shakes its head and storms away, with the toaster following. The mailbox looks at the toaster for a long moment as the toaster stares back, then suddenly softens and drops its hood, looks into the mailbox's eyes, and walks away, while the mailbox watches it go and exits. The pineapple picks through its paper as it and the mailbox sit at a basket, then it grabs its umbrella, slides out of the basket, and heads to the gardener's shed with the mailbox following, offering a puzzled shrug. The pineapple gestures with a 'just wait' tail when the gardener turns to it, as the mailbox stares at it, then ahead, swerving the wheel to the right to pull the wagon to the side of the barn, throws it into park, noting the wind is a bit fiercer now. The mailbox stares at the pineapple, and it stares back before getting out of the wagon. With the wind now howling, the pineapple starts hitching up the mountain, and the mailbox reaches it, with both being drenched. It shakes its head ruefully and walks away, leaving the mailbox standing there at a loss before it turns and heads back to its wagon.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action Corruption
test_cases.description: Molly reclines back into the hammock, wearing a puzzled face, as the Sailors and Morris giggle, prompting Ryan and Molly to cautiously join in, though Molly sends Ryan a 'these folks are clowns' glance, and Ryan grins. Later, Denise and Ryan skip through the garden, munching on sandwiches, and upon reaching a roundabout, they settle down on the merry-go-round. Denise raises her foot, and after swallowing what she's chewing, she stretches her arm, which is just enormous, leaving Ryan mesmerized. Denise retracts it with a smirk and rises, then departs while Ryan remains on the merry-go-round. Denise returns as Molly attempts to balance a mountain of groceries, while Ryan checks his pager and departs. Molly begins sorting her comics, and a cat wanders in, gazing at her before disappearing, leaving Molly standing dumbfounded. They head toward the dartboards, where Ryan tosses the dart, landing it in a twenty-point slot. Denise picks up a dart, squints to aim, and launches it sidearm, causing it to ricochet off one of the targets and ricochet back, making them duck. Ryan flinches as Denise chuckles, and he ducks again as the dart comes zooming back at his head, then jumps up and hurls the dart in disbelief, causing it to bounce off the wall and crack through the screen of an old jukebox, while Denise chuckles. Later, Molly stands there, amazed, puts the remote down, and moves to the drafting table, where Ryan starts sketching as Molly gazes at him, then starts sketching something herself. Molly sketches a busy intersection, finishes sketching, and narrates according to her monologue. Ryan shakes his head and storms off, with Molly trailing behind. Ryan gazes at Molly for a long moment as Molly looks back, then unexpectedly relaxes and lowers her head, gazes into Ryan's eyes, and strolls off, while Ryan watches her leave and exits. Denise nibbles at her pasta as she and Ryan sit at a counter, then she grabs her jacket, slides out of the counter, and wanders to the cashier's desk with Ryan trailing, offering a bewildered shrug. Denise signals with a 'just a sec' hand gesture when the cashier turns to her, as Ryan gazes at her, then forward, veering the wheel to the left to pull the bicycle to the edge of the street, kicks it into stand mode, noting the drizzle is a bit heavier now. Ryan gazes at Denise, and she gazes back before stepping out of the bicycle lane. With the drizzle now pouring, Denise starts trekking up the path, and Ryan reaches her, with both being soaked. She shakes her head remorsefully and strolls off, leaving Ryan standing there bewildered before he turns and pedals back to his bicycle.

test_cases.name: Object-Action Corruption
test_cases.description: Banky slouches into the hammock, wearing a bemused expression, as the Execs and Sloss snicker, prompting Holden and Banky to awkwardly join in, though Banky shoots Holden a 'these guys are fools' look, and Holden grins. Later, Alyssa and Holden dance through the arcade, munching on pretzels, and upon reaching a carousel, they perch on the horses. Alyssa raises her hand, and after gulping down what she's munching, she reveals her accordion, which is just enormous, leaving Holden mesmerized. Alyssa retracts it with a smirk and rises, then departs while Holden remains on the horse. Alyssa reappears as Banky attempts to juggle way-too-many groceries, while Holden checks his pager and departs. Banky starts stacking his vinyl records, and a stray cat enters, glaring at him before vanishing, leaving Banky standing slack-jawed. They head toward the dartboard, where Holden tosses the dart, landing it in a low-scoring zone. Alyssa picks up a dart, narrows her eyes to aim, and flings it backward, causing it to bounce off one of the zones and ricochet back, making them duck. Holden reacts as Alyssa giggles, and he ducks again as the dart zooms back at his face, then leaps up and wings the dart in shock, causing it to ping off the rafters and crash through the window of an old jukebox, while Alyssa chuckles. Later, Banky sits there, dumbfounded, places the remote down, and ambles to the sketchpad, where Holden starts doodling as Banky gapes at him, then starts sketching something himself. Banky sketches a roundabout, completes the sketch, and narrates according to his voice-over. Holden shakes his head and storms off, with Banky following. Holden glances at Banky for a long moment as Banky gawks back, then suddenly softens and lowers his gaze, looks into Holden's eyes, and strolls away, while Holden watches him go and leaves. Alyssa sifts through her noodles as she and Holden sit at a table, then she grabs her hat, slides out of the booth, and heads to the checkout counter with Holden trailing, offering a perplexed shrug. Alyssa signals with a 'just a moment' finger when the cashier turns to her, as Holden gawks at her, then onward, veering the handlebars to the right to pull the bike to the side of the path, drops it into neutral, noting the breeze is a bit stronger now. Holden gapes at Alyssa, and she gazes back before stepping off the bike. With the breeze now gusting, Alyssa starts skipping up the path, and Holden reaches her, with both being flustered. She shakes her head wistfully and walks away, leaving Holden standing there bewildered before he turns and heads back to his bike.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: Griffin tilts forward into the hammock, wearing a confused grin, as the Engineers and Rake howl, prompting Miles and Griffin to awkwardly join in, though Griffin tosses Miles a 'these folks are clueless' glare, and Miles grins. Later, Clara and Miles stroll through the forest, munching on pretzels, and upon reaching a boulder, they plop down on the rocks. Clara raises her foot, and after gulping what she's chewing, she unveils her wrist, which is just enormous, leaving Miles mesmerized. Clara tucks it back with a chuckle and rises, then departs while Miles stays on the rock. Clara returns as Griffin struggles to juggle way-too-many umbrellas, while Miles checks his pager and departs. Griffin begins stacking his newspapers up, and a small cat sneaks in, glaring at him before vanishing, leaving Griffin standing slack-jawed. They shuffle toward the merry-go-round, where Miles spins the wheel, landing it in a ten-point basket. Clara picks up a disc, squints to focus, and launches it underhand, causing it to skip off one of the targets and whiz back, making them duck. Miles blinks as Clara giggles, and he ducks again as the disc comes whizzing past his ear, then leaps up and flips the disc in shock, causing it to deflect off the ceiling and crash through the window of an ancient jukebox, while Clara giggles. Later, Griffin flops there, stunned, sets the joystick down, and paces to the painting bench, where Miles begins sketching as Griffin gawks at him, then starts doodling something himself. Griffin sketches a roundabout, finishes sketching, and illustrates according to his monologue. Miles sighs and storms away, with Griffin tailing him. Miles glares at Griffin for an extended beat as Griffin glowers back, then abruptly relaxes and lowers his head, peers into Miles's eyes, and ambles off, while Miles watches him leave and departs. Clara sifts through her salad as she and Miles rest at a counter, then she grabs her backpack, slides off the stool, and heads to the manager's desk with Miles in tow, offering a baffled shrug. Clara signals with a 'hold on' thumb when the manager turns to her, as Miles gazes at her, then forward, twisting the knob to the left to steer the boat to the edge of the river, drops anchor, observing the sky is a bit cloudier now. Miles gazes at Clara, and she gazes back before stepping out of the boat. With the storm now raging, Clara starts meandering up the path, and Miles reaches her, both getting soaked. She sighs thoughtfully and struts away, leaving Miles standing there perplexed before he pivots and heads back to his boat.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: Banky reclines on the couch, exchanging a knowing glance with Holden as they humor execs with laughter. Later, Alyssa and Holden stroll through the park and pause at a swing set, where Alyssa surprises Holden with her large tongue. Afterward, as Banky grapples with too much luggage, Holden checks his beeper and leaves. At the skee-ball runs, Alyssa's overhand throw sends a ball flying back at them while Holden's shot smashes a pinball machine, amusing Alyssa. At home, Banky and Holden draw, leading to a tense moment as Holden storms off, but Banky softens and walks away. In a diner, Alyssa gestures to Holden as they leave, and he pulls the car over in heavy rain. Alyssa exits, hitching up the road, drenched, while Holden stands confused before returning to his car.

test_cases.name: Reverse Segments Order
test_cases.description: She shakes her head ruefully and walks away leaving Holden standing there at a loss before he turns and heads back to his car With the rain now pouring Alyssa starts hitching up the road and Holden reaches her with both being drenched Holden stares at Alyssa and she stares back before getting out of the car Alyssa gestures with a 'just wait' finger when the cashier turns to her as Holden stares at her then ahead swerving the wheel to the right to pull the car to the side of the road throws it into park noting the rain is a bit heavier now Alyssa picks through her food as she and Holden sit at a booth then she grabs her bag slides out of the booth and heads to the cashier's desk with Holden following offering a puzzled shrug Holden looks at Banky for a long moment as Banky stares back then suddenly softens and drops his head looks into Holden's eyes and walks away while Holden watches him go and exits Holden shakes his head and storms away with Banky following Banky draws a fourway stop finishes drawing and illustrates according to his voiceover Later Banky sits there shocked puts the controller down and crosses to the drawing table where Holden starts drawing as Banky stares at him then starts drawing something himself Holden reacts as Alyssa laughs and he ducks again as the ball comes sailing back at his head then gets up and throws the ball in surprise causing it to ricochet off the ceiling and smash through the glass of an old pinball machine while Alyssa laughs Alyssa picks up a ball squints to aim and throws it overhand causing it to pop off one of the circles and shoot back making them duck They head toward the skeeball runs where Holden rolls the ball landing it in a twentypoint circle Banky starts packing his magazines up and a little kid enters staring at him before disappearing leaving Banky standing openmouthed Alyssa returns as Banky tries to balance waytoomuch luggage while Holden checks his beeper and exits Alyssa wraps it back up with a smile and stands then exits while Holden remains in the swing Alyssa holds up her hand and after swallowing what she is chewing she releases her tongue which is just huge leaving Holden transfixed Later Alyssa and Holden walk through the park eating hot dogs and upon reaching a swing set they sit down on the swings Banky leans back into the couch wearing a thoughtful face as the Execs and Sloss laugh prompting Holden and Banky to politely join in though Banky shoots Holden a 'these guys are idiots' look and Holden smiles
